titleStmt.title: H. G. Davis et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2269

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Cadiz Ky Novr 13th 1865
To His Excellency, Thos, E, Bramlette
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,
Dear Sir;

We the undersigned, citizens of Trigg Co. Kentucky, would respectfully represent unto your Excellency, that there is no Notary Public in this County, and that cases frequently occur in which it is desirable and necessary to have them proven before, and certified by a Notary Public, We would therefore respectfully request your Excellency, to appoint a Notary Public for Trigg County, Ky. at your earliest convenience, and we would beg leave to recommend, Majr Arthur Smith, of Cadiz, Trigg Co, as a suitable person to discharge the duties of Notary Public. Majr Smith is, and has been during the War of the Rebellion, an unswerving and uncompromising Union man, Hoping you will give this matter, your earliest attention,

We remain
Govr your Obdt Servts,

H, G, Davis
William Shuler
late 2nd Lt. 3d Ky Cav, &c Adjt 28 Ky Infantry
W. C Thompson
Post, Master. Cadiz Kentucky
Sanford Lindsay
Tho, C, Dabney

Notary Public
Trigg Co
Arthur Smith
apptd
19 Novr/65
